description: Construction of 1 x 3 bedroom detached dwelling house (comprising of basement, ground floor, first floor and habitable loft) following the demolition of existing garage; provision of refuse storage, car parking and landscaping.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawing(s) and document(s): Proposed Elevations, Drawing Number 03, dated 17/03/2017; Proposed Lower Ground Floor, Drawing Number 04, dated 17/03/2017; Proposed Ground Floor, Drawing Number 05, dated 17/03/2017; Proposed 1st Floor, Drawing Number 06, dated 17/03/2017; Proposed 2nd Floor, Drawing Number 07, dated 17/03/2017; Proposed Section Y-Y, Drawing Number 08, dated 17/03/2017; Proposed Site Plan, Drawing Number 09, dated 17/03/2017; Planning, Design and Access Statement, dated March 2017
REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall be consistent with those as listed on the submitted application form and the approved plans as listed in Condition (2).

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 and 2.10, and policies 7.1, 7.2, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A - I of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015, no permitted development shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.

REASON: To ensure orderly development, in accordance with policies 1.1 (g) (h), 1.2 (f), 3.1(b) and 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and with policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).

| Cycle storage for a minimum of two (2) bicycles in accordance with all adopted standards shall be provided within the curtilage of the property prior to occupation of the building and be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.
REASON: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and policy 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016).

| The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage, in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards, has been provided in the curtilage of the property as indicated on the approved plans and has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

REASON: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Adopted Ealing Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policies 7.4, and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).
| The installation in the dwelling of an ultra-low NOx boiler with maximum NOx emissions of under 40 mg/kWh shall be completed prior to occupation and thereafter permanently retained.
REASON: In order to comply with Ealing Council's commitment to being an Air Quality Exemplar Borough and policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016).

| The development herby approved must be provided with filtered fresh air ventilation system capable of mitigating elevated concentrations of nitrogen oxides in the external air. The ventilation system shall be completed prior to occupation and shall be retained permanently thereafter.

REASON: In the interests of the internal environment of the development in accordance with SPG10: Noise & Vibration, policies 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013), policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016) and National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Building envelope insulation for the approved residential building, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets adopted by the Local Planning Authority:
a.	Bedrooms (23.00-07.00 hrs) 30 dB LAeq and 45 dB Lmax (fast).
b.	Living rooms (07.00-23.00 hrs) 35 dB LAeq.
c.	Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (07.00-23.00 hrs) 45 dB LAeq.
The sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to the first use and / or first occupation of the flats and maintained thereafter.

REASON: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013) and SPG10: Noise and Vibration.

| A detailed method statement relating to the demolition of demolition of the existing garage two storey, excavation of basement level  and construction of dwellinghouse (1x3 bedroom) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the use on-site.  The statement shall include the following details:
a.	Removal of any earth from the site.
b.	Site clearance, demolition, excavation and construction methods.
c.	Site management and access.
d.	Signage for construction traffic, pedestrians and other users of the site.
e.	Prevention of mud and debris being deposited on Woodfield Road, Woodfield Crescent and B455.
f.	Vehicle and machinery specification.
g.	Turning manoeuvres and routeing of vehicles.
h.	Estimated number and frequency of vehicle deliveries.
i.	Parking of construction vehicles.
j.	Compliance with noise limits and vibration mitigation measures.
k.	Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents.
l.	Mitigation of air pollution and dust emissions during site clearance, demolition, excavation and construction works.
m.	Waste management, hazardous material storage and removal.

REASON:  In the interest of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impacts during the course of the works, in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013).
| The developer shall draw to the attention of the Local Planning Authority the presence of any unsuspected contamination encountered during the development.

a.	In the event of contamination to land and/or water being encountered, no development shall continue until a programme of investigation and/or remedial work to include methods of monitoring and certification of such work undertaken has been submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

None of the development shall be occupied until the approved remedial works, monitoring and certification of the works have been carried out and a full validation report has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
OR

b.	In the event that no contamination is encountered, the developer shall provide a written statement to the Local Planning Authority confirming that this was the case, and only after written approval by the Local Planning Authority shall the development be occupied.

REASON: To ensure that any ground and water contamination is identified and adequately addressed to ensure the safety of the development, the environment and to ensure the site is suitable for the proposed use.
| No part of the side elevations of the dwellinghouse hereby approved shall incorporate a side window. This condition shall stand for the lifetime of the development hereby approved.

REASON: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (2016), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and polices 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012
